alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hancock, Van Buren, Keokuk, Washington, Jefferson, Henry, southwestern Des Moines, west central Louisa, southwestern Johnson, Iowa, Lee, northeastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Delta to near Birmingham to 9 miles southwest of Wayland. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. Airport observation sites have measured wind gusts to around 40 mph or greater over the last hour. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fairfield, Delta, Stockport and Hayesville around 635 PM CDT. Sigourney and What Cheer around 640 PM CDT. Lockridge around 645 PM CDT. Rome around 650 PM CDT. Keswick and St. Francisville around 655 PM CDT. South English around 700 PM CDT. Keokuk and Coppock around 705 PM CDT. North English, Wayland, Millersburg and Kinross around 710 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Charleston, Geode State Park, Clark County Fairgrounds, Pekin, Germanville, Indian Lake Park, Peaksville, Swedesburg, Washington County Fairgrounds and Galland. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 211 and 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
